alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Okanogan Highlands; Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 23 at 4:50AM PDT until October 25 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FIRST MODERATE SNOW EVENT FOR THE INLAND NORTHWEST ARRIVES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY... .Significant mountain snow accumulation above 3000 feet and measurable snow for lower elevations below 2500 feet. A robust and cold weather system will deliver mountain snow, lowland rain-snow, and colder overnight temperatures lingering through the remainder of the week. Mountain passes will be impacted by the heavy snowfall and lowland areas may see impacts to trees and sensitive vegetation from wet snow accumulation. ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON ESPECIALLY ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible especially elevations above 3000 feet. Total snow accumulations between 6 to 12 inches above 3000 feet and 1 to 6 inches below 3000 feet. * WHERE...Boulder Creek Road, Leavenworth, Stehekin, Methow, Republic, Twisp, Sherman Pass, Mazama, Wauconda, Inchelium, Plain, Highway 20 Wauconda Summit, Stevens Pass, Chesaw Road, Winthrop, Loup Loup Pass, Holden Village, and Conconully. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be challenging and difficult over mountain passes and high elevation roadways. Theses winter weather conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes on higher elevation roadways and passes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Okanogan Highlands; Western Chelan County; Western Okanogan County
